reviews.text: We had the breakfast special. It comes with two eggs, choice of meat, and a ‚Äúsweet‚Äù. I had the liege waffles and partner had the crepe with blackberry cream. Portion wise, you don‚Äôt get a good bang for your buck. The food is good enough so no complaints there, but the breakfast special in particular isn‚Äôt worth the $13.25. We also got Colombian coffee which was the best part. Overall, I wouldn‚Äôt comeback, I‚Äôm just glad to have gone.

My recent dining experience at A Bite of Belgium was truly exceptional and deserves a more detailed account. Stepping inside, I was immediately struck by the thoughtfully curated decor, which fostered an atmosphere of genuine comfort and relaxation. Soft lighting and cozy seating arrangements created an inviting ambiance that made me feel instantly at ease. The attentiveness and personable nature of my waitress further enhanced the welcoming environment. She was prompt, knowledgeable about the menu, and offered helpful suggestions, making the entire service feel both efficient and friendly.

For my main course, I selected the sirloin tip sandwich, a decision I did not regret for a moment. The quality of the ingredients was immediately apparent. The sirloin tips were cooked to perfection, boasting a rich and savory flavor that was incredibly satisfying. What truly elevated this sandwich was the homemade rye bread. Its freshness and slightly tangy flavor provided the ideal complement to the tender sirloin, creating a harmonious blend of textures and tastes.

To accompany my sandwich, I opted for the goat cheese pasta salad. This side dish proved to be a delightful surprise. The creamy goat cheese was expertly balanced with the perfectly cooked pasta and a medley of fresh, vibrant vegetables. The dressing was light and flavorful, tying all the elements together beautifully. It was a refreshing and well-composed salad that showcased a thoughtful approach to flavor combinations.

Finally, I also sampled the French-style green salad with oil and garlic dressing. While seemingly simple, this salad was a testament to the fact that high-quality ingredients and a well-executed dressing can be truly outstanding. The greens were crisp and fresh, and the oil and garlic dressing was light yet incredibly flavorful, providing a refreshing counterpoint to the richer elements of my meal.

In conclusion, my visit to A Bite of Belgium was a thoroughly enjoyable and memorable experience. The restaurant excelled in every aspect, from the comfortable and inviting atmosphere to the exceptional service provided by my waitress. Most importantly, the food was outstanding, characterized by the freshness and high quality of the ingredients and the skillful preparation of each dish. The sirloin tip sandwich on homemade rye bread, the flavorful goat cheese pasta salad, and the refreshing French-style green salad all contributed to an excellent meal that I would highly recommend. A Bite of Belgium has clearly prioritized creating a welcoming space where guests can enjoy delicious, well-crafted food, and I eagerly anticipate my next visit.

Words can't sum up just how decadent this place is. The food is over the top and can't be beat. Service is stellar and 5 star.

The menu is huge!!! So many choices. Each is more indulgent than the last.

Outdoor patio area is very nice with birds chirping and shade.

This place is very special, but you will find excuses to treat yourself and keep coming back.

Beautiful shaped over easy eggs. Thickest whipped cream I've ever had. Everything was plated artistically, and every single bite was delicious. Great espresso. Our server was incredibly attentive and very patient with our indecisive group. Menu had so many options to pick from, including spam dishes.

Edit: I came back after another camping trip nearby, and quality stays consistently good. Their salmon was a bit tough but tasted great.

The food presentation was good but the taste was not upto the par and the dishes were too expensive. For a $9 kid‚Äôs grilled cheese it was too expensive for a slice of bread. Giving them a 1-star for the service, they didn‚Äôt offer booster for our kid, didn‚Äôt give the kids goodies (wikki stix), and I had to ask twice for them to fill up my water glass. However, the  server was too quick to grab the card from us, maybe they want us to leave quickly. lol. The space was too cramped up and not spacious at all.

editorial_summary.overview: Li√®ge waffles, burgers & other Belgian-style fare for breakfast, lunch & dinner in a simple setting.

recentReviews.text: The food was great, and our waitress was super attentive. We'll definitely be back for dinner!

This is a long overdue review of my experience from last year. I came here at the suggestion of a coworker when I came for a two week business trip. I waited to come here until the second week and I really wish I didn't! I‚Äôll summarize my review in one sentence. After my first visit, I returned for every breakfast and dinner for the last 4 days of my trip! The food was that good. The service was mostly great, but had a coupe of issues that were resolved. I tried the waffles, crepes, French Toast, a couple of seafood meals (Shrimp and grits were excellent!) and a chicken dish that was both new to me and outstanding! I wish I wasn‚Äôt retired so I would have an excuse to return to Los Cruces for another plate of Bananas Foster French Toast!

We had never been for dinner and were surprisingly impressed. We were the only people there and were worried what that meant, but everything was great, from food to service!  We even got a coupon through text after calling to check to see how busy they were.
Great onion rings. Love the Gluten free options. Half price wine bottles on Wednesday, Thursday, and Sunday from 4-8. Also, great prices overall !

Yummy yummy yummy  food !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!            Awesome service.
(Review written by my 9 year old; their school went on a field trip to Bite of Belgium and he came home and raved about how much he loved it ‚ò∫Ô∏è)

detailedReviews.author: Dale Menges
detailedReviews.text: Outstanding cuisine and service!

detailedReviews.author: Emilia Cruz
detailedReviews.text: The food was great, and our waitress was super attentive. We'll definitely be back for dinner!

detailedReviews.author: S J
detailedReviews.text: This is a long overdue review of my experience from last year. I came here at the suggestion of a coworker when I came for a two week business trip. I waited to come here until the second week and I really wish I didn't! I‚Äôll summarize my review in one sentence. After my first visit, I returned for every breakfast and dinner for the last 4 days of my trip! The food was that good. The service was mostly great, but had a coupe of issues that were resolved. I tried the waffles, crepes, French Toast, a couple of seafood meals (Shrimp and grits were excellent!) and a chicken dish that was both new to me and outstanding! I wish I wasn‚Äôt retired so I would have an excuse to return to Los Cruces for another plate of Bananas Foster French Toast!

detailedReviews.author: Amber Cogan
detailedReviews.text: We had never been for dinner and were surprisingly impressed. We were the only people there and were worried what that meant, but everything was great, from food to service!  We even got a coupon through text after calling to check to see how busy they were.

detailedReviews.author: Karen Caroe
detailedReviews.text: Great onion rings. Love the Gluten free options. Half price wine bottles on Wednesday, Thursday, and Sunday from 4-8. Also, great prices overall !

detailedReviews.author: Chelsea
detailedReviews.text:
Yummy yummy yummy  food !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!            Awesome service.
(Review written by my 9 year old; their school went on a field trip to Bite of Belgium and he came home and raved about how much he loved it ‚ò∫Ô∏è)

detailedReviews.author: William Cooke
detailedReviews.text: The food and service here was outstanding. Everything we had was very good and very well made. The service was top notch. Highly recommend.

detailedReviews.author: Mitch Baxter
detailedReviews.text: We had the breakfast special. It comes with two eggs, choice of meat, and a ‚Äúsweet‚Äù. I had the liege waffles and partner had the crepe with blackberry cream. Portion wise, you don‚Äôt get a good bang for your buck. The food is good enough so no complaints there, but the breakfast special in particular isn‚Äôt worth the $13.25. We also got Colombian coffee which was the best part. Overall, I wouldn‚Äôt comeback, I‚Äôm just glad to have gone.

detailedReviews.author: Glen Ernst
detailedReviews.text: My potatoes arrived cold and mushy.  My wife‚Äôs food arrived cold and the tampequena stake was tasteless, dry and very tough.

detailedReviews.author: Terry Rostro
detailedReviews.text:
My recent dining experience at A Bite of Belgium was truly exceptional and deserves a more detailed account. Stepping inside, I was immediately struck by the thoughtfully curated decor, which fostered an atmosphere of genuine comfort and relaxation. Soft lighting and cozy seating arrangements created an inviting ambiance that made me feel instantly at ease. The attentiveness and personable nature of my waitress further enhanced the welcoming environment. She was prompt, knowledgeable about the menu, and offered helpful suggestions, making the entire service feel both efficient and friendly.

For my main course, I selected the sirloin tip sandwich, a decision I did not regret for a moment. The quality of the ingredients was immediately apparent. The sirloin tips were cooked to perfection, boasting a rich and savory flavor that was incredibly satisfying. What truly elevated this sandwich was the homemade rye bread. Its freshness and slightly tangy flavor provided the ideal complement to the tender sirloin, creating a harmonious blend of textures and tastes.

To accompany my sandwich, I opted for the goat cheese pasta salad. This side dish proved to be a delightful surprise. The creamy goat cheese was expertly balanced with the perfectly cooked pasta and a medley of fresh, vibrant vegetables. The dressing was light and flavorful, tying all the elements together beautifully. It was a refreshing and well-composed salad that showcased a thoughtful approach to flavor combinations.

Finally, I also sampled the French-style green salad with oil and garlic dressing. While seemingly simple, this salad was a testament to the fact that high-quality ingredients and a well-executed dressing can be truly outstanding. The greens were crisp and fresh, and the oil and garlic dressing was light yet incredibly flavorful, providing a refreshing counterpoint to the richer elements of my meal.

In conclusion, my visit to A Bite of Belgium was a thoroughly enjoyable and memorable experience. The restaurant excelled in every aspect, from the comfortable and inviting atmosphere to the exceptional service provided by my waitress. Most importantly, the food was outstanding, characterized by the freshness and high quality of the ingredients and the skillful preparation of each dish. The sirloin tip sandwich on homemade rye bread, the flavorful goat cheese pasta salad, and the refreshing French-style green salad all contributed to an excellent meal that I would highly recommend. A Bite of Belgium has clearly prioritized creating a welcoming space where guests can enjoy delicious, well-crafted food, and I eagerly anticipate my next visit.

detailedReviews.author: Gerard Alonzo
detailedReviews.text: Too expensive, loud and crowded but good food.

detailedReviews.author: Jim Hohmann
detailedReviews.text: I've only eaten there for breakfast so this is my first time having dinner there and it was fantastic

detailedReviews.author: Aaron Keener
detailedReviews.text: Amazing food! It was a short walk from the place we rented, ate breakfast there every day of out trip, delicious food and excellent service!

detailedReviews.author: Mia Rue
detailedReviews.text: Wow! Excellent gluten free pancakes. Service was EXCELLENT too, fast, accommodating, friendly, just great. And very well priced!

detailedReviews.author: Mariana Reeves
detailedReviews.text: The waffles were a little hard for my liking.

detailedReviews.author: Angela Gonzalez
detailedReviews.text: Food and service are excellent every time! My only critique would be plate sizes are quite oversized in comparison to the small table sizes. When you add in that many menu items come with a main and a side on separate plates, it is usually a struggle to fit everything on the table somewhere. Please consider dishware that is in scale with the size of the table.

detailedReviews.author: Chaska Peacock
detailedReviews.text: We were left standing for a long time waiting to b seated.  It was a few minutes after 11 on a week day.  The menu has options for everyone, and our food was good.  The atmosphere is bland and the seating is very close. I will try it again, however.

detailedReviews.author: Elizabeth G
detailedReviews.text:
After hearing this place from other people my sister and I decided to try it out. I ordered the eggs Benedict and my sister ordered the huevos rancheros.
Unfortunately the hollandaise sauce was broken and liquidy and my eggs were raw. My sister was not satisfied with her plate however she still ate it.
I did not eat mine due to the raw egg. It took a while for our server to check on us and I told her my concern and she called the manager. He came over and said they would only refund my eggs (mind you I did not eat anything on that plate including the hashbrowns (which are not made fresh they are frozen) and what they call a side salad). After I told him this (and he could see it) he was looking for an excuse to not refund my plate, but ended up doing so, didn‚Äôt apologize.
I never write reviews however i feel like i needed to because of how we were not checked in throughout the hour we were there and there was only one other table. Also, my plate was 17.50, which is completely overpriced and not worth it. I would think they would make a good sauce, well cooked eggs, and fresh hashbrowns for that price. I would not recommend eating here.

detailedReviews.author: Maria Diaz
detailedReviews.text: simply perfect üëå service, food et.

detailedReviews.author: JoLynn Hanley
detailedReviews.text: The wait staff was very friendly and accommodating. Treated the Veteran I was with respectfully. The food was delicious.We had a breakfast special and a chicken fried steak breakfast.

detailedReviews.author: Laura Howe
detailedReviews.text: Only reason I gave 4 is because portions are small for the price.. otherwise food was good and the staff know their stuff!!!

detailedReviews.author: Sherry Fletcher
detailedReviews.text: Awesome gluten-free pain pardu! Cappuccino was amazing as well as was the service!

detailedReviews.author: Bea Navarrete
detailedReviews.text: Food terrible, service, you need to know someone there, to get a table, if not you have to wait a long time even if you got there before this people, terrible! Do not recommend.

detailedReviews.author: M Jerene
detailedReviews.text: Delicious and reasonable price

detailedReviews.author: Dillon Jenkins
detailedReviews.text: What a wonderful dining experience!! Gabby and Matin were our servers and they were truly the kindest, most accomodating servers we‚Äôve ever had! We were passing thru town and so happy we ate there. The food was delicious with fresh baked breads, great sandwiches, waffles and French toast to die for. Thank you Gabby and Martin!!ü•∞

detailedReviews.author: Bailey Guerra
detailedReviews.text: Had such a wonderful time here today! We recently moved here and it‚Äôs hard to find a restaurant that isn‚Äôt packed with heat!! My neighbor recommended Bite of Belgium. We‚Äôve been here for dinner, Kyra was our server both times, she made us feel so welcomed and helped us so much too! The restaurant is pet friendly so our dogs got to sit inside with us! The waffles are so yummy!! The vegan options are amazing! We will be back for breakfast lunch and dinner!! Thank you Kyra!!

detailedReviews.author: Sidney Graham
detailedReviews.text: Nice selection. My waffles were pretty hard and dry, but still tasted fairly good with the toppings added. Very busy, but we made a reservation and were seated quickly.

detailedReviews.author: Mr P
detailedReviews.text: Great food and they have gluten free options that taste just as good as their gluten counterparts.

detailedReviews.author: I G
detailedReviews.text: Love the customer service and food.

detailedReviews.author: John Fahrion
detailedReviews.text: The restaurant is very quaint with a beautiful interior and has patio seating as well. It has a well appointed menu with a lot of attractive options. The food is exceptional and the staff is warm and welcoming.

detailedReviews.author: Paul Miller
detailedReviews.text:
Words can't sum up just how decadent this place is. The food is over the top and can't be beat. Service is stellar and 5 star.

The menu is huge!!! So many choices. Each is more indulgent than the last.

Outdoor patio area is very nice with birds chirping and shade.

This place is very special, but you will find excuses to treat yourself and keep coming back.

detailedReviews.author: Jose Escalante
detailedReviews.text: It's always a good time. The food is excellent  and the service is fast and friendly

detailedReviews.author: Muddy Ruttzz
detailedReviews.text:
Forget the usual, we landed at Bite of Belgium and were transported. My wife indulged in a perfectly crafted corned beef hash and eggs, beautifully paired with waffles and zesty lemon cream. As for me? I ventured into the delightful unknown with a colossal, artistic creation of waffles, cream, fruit, and chocolate. It was a rich, delectable masterpiece that nearly sent me into a happy food coma! üò¥ Thankfully, their strong, excellent coffee was just the revival I needed. ‚òï

Beyond breakfast, this gem transforms into Gatsby's Bistro for "A Bite At Night," offering an array of magnificent lunch and dinner entrees. The service is impeccable, the ambiance truly transports you, and the food is simply an edible work of art. If you're living in or visiting Las Cruces, you absolutely must experience this place! Bonus: plenty of parking. üòâ

#BiteOfBelgium #LasCrucesEats #GatsbysBistro #BelgianWaffles #FoodieAdventure #BrunchGoals #LocalGem #NewMexicoFood #CulinaryDelight #EdibleArt #SupportLocal #muddyruttzz

detailedReviews.author: Kelly B
detailedReviews.text:
If you're craving authentic Belgian cuisine in a cozy, charming setting, The Belgium Cafe is the place to be. This hidden gem offers a fantastic menu with everything from rich crepes to perfectly crisp Belgian waffles. The food is flavorful, fresh, and with perfect portions that never disappoint. They also offer a Vegan menu.

The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, always ready with recommendations or a quick chat about the menu.

Don't skip the Mimosa, Wine, and Belgian beer selection‚Äîit‚Äôs a perfect match for the meals. Whether you're stopping by for a casual meal or a more leisurely dining experience, The Belgium Cafe delivers both great food and a relaxed vibe.

detailedReviews.author: Pat Guerard
detailedReviews.text: Great place for breakfast or brunch! Drinks are delicious desserts need more belgian chocolate!

detailedReviews.author: Don David
detailedReviews.text: A quaint little restaurant that you wouldn't expect to find in Las Cruces NM.  Food was good and the service was great.  Also the place had a nice atmosphere and everyone was very friendly.

detailedReviews.author: Sabrina Kelly
detailedReviews.text:
We were so exhausted from a long drive and wanted to sit down for a nice brunch.
Our server Liz was so kind and patient with us, she really brightened our day in addition to the delicious food!

detailedReviews.author: Justin Ott
detailedReviews.text: Easily one of our top favorite restaurants in the country. The best waffles I‚Äôve ever had in my life. My favorite is waffles bacon and cream (try their different creams!! Strawberry, Bavarian, espresso‚Ä¶). Love their eggs Benedict (all versions), and LOVE the corned beef hash. There‚Äôs no canned corned beef found here. Real fresh brisket chunks!! Don‚Äôt miss out.

detailedReviews.author: Pam Kingdon
detailedReviews.text: Even during the busy breakfast/lunch hour we are always seated quickly. There‚Äôs an extensive menu with many gluten free options. Food is delicious and wait staff is quick to check on you. Only downside is the noise level. It‚Äôs sometimes difficult to carry on a conversation in certain parts of the restaurant.

detailedReviews.author: Kathy
detailedReviews.text: Absolutely a hidden jem ‚ù§Ô∏è

detailedReviews.author: Sarai Kendrick
detailedReviews.text: Southwest breakfast was excellent. Lamb sandwich was flavorless and not great. Waitress forgot items, didn't refill water.

detailedReviews.author: Diane Bryan
detailedReviews.text: Our waiter was great, even with his other big tables!  Quiche was fabulous.  Disappointed the waffle though.  It was dry.

detailedReviews.author: Jamie Charrette
detailedReviews.text: Perfect! Best corned beef hash I've ever eaten. Lieg√© waffles just like in Belgium. Great coffee. Our server Liz was amazing! I can't recommend this place enough!

detailedReviews.author: Kay ‚ÄúDwessie‚Äù Dwessie
detailedReviews.text: Great food, great music, and amazing service from Liz! Couldn't eat it all, but these are leftovers I'm looking forward to!

detailedReviews.author: Kianna Taylor
detailedReviews.text: Loved the energy of our waitress! It's nice when the staff is knowledgeable about the food. First time here and was blown away by the Bavarian Cream waffles. It was a wonderful experience.

detailedReviews.author: Donald Huckaby
detailedReviews.text:
1st time here. Excellent food,service and atmosphere. I will go back.
I have wanted to try this place out, and just kept forgetting about it. So I went with my daughter, and was not disappointed.
Well worth your time and effort to go.

detailedReviews.author: Marisela Herrera
detailedReviews.text: Sunday brunch with the family was very joyful. The food was great! Service was on point!

detailedReviews.author: Sugar Fierro
detailedReviews.text: It was great, the food was good and service was great üëç üëå

detailedReviews.author: Tamera Ahner
detailedReviews.text: Don't miss the 1/2 price wines on Wed, Thurs, Sun. Steak was fantastic!

detailedReviews.author: Chlo-E Vincent
detailedReviews.text: Food is always consistently awesome!!! Staff fantastic...

detailedReviews.author: Belinda Villegas
detailedReviews.text: Amazing food, and drinks!! Great service, enjoy coming here for some amazing Belgium waffles!

detailedReviews.author: Deborah Torres
detailedReviews.text: I‚Äôve been here a number of times and never disappointed üíõüíõüíõüëçüèºüí™üèºü´∂üèº

detailedReviews.author: William Mackmiller
detailedReviews.text: The morning service and the dinner service is excellent. Staff is great at attending to your needs.  Our family loves to go to bite of Belgium. Highly recommend!  Not a dish on the menu you won‚Äôt like!

detailedReviews.author: Jessica Valencia
detailedReviews.text: I had an amazing experience. The food was plated beautifully and our server Liz gave us great service. We sat in the patio and everything was brought to us in a timely manner. I left the place with a smile ü©∑

detailedReviews.author: Pablo Lucero
detailedReviews.text: A must stop for breakfast. Lovely atmosphere, great wait staff, very attentive to your needs and very friendly. The food was phenomenal. You can tell the food was made from scratch, from the waffles, the french toast and biscuits. I can't tell you how much better the food tastes. Just come by and give it a try. You will not be disappointed.

detailedReviews.author: Colby Crain
detailedReviews.text: Liz was phenomenal‚Ä¶will be back!

detailedReviews.author: Lilly Rawlyk
detailedReviews.text: Prompt service and great food!

detailedReviews.author: Gina R
detailedReviews.text: Great food and service!  Liz helped us decide on the menu items.  Owner spoke to us about how he makes the corned beef Hash.  It was so good...we are coming back for take-out food before they close at 2 pm.  Best restaurant we have eaten at while traveling cross country.  (Almost 14 years in business...they know what they are doing!)  Love that they have a nice parking lot directly across the street.

detailedReviews.author: Michael DeLain
detailedReviews.text: Excellent breakfast. Fantastic decor and wonderful service. Everything was worth coming back for.

detailedReviews.author: Rhonda W
detailedReviews.text:
I hate to disparage a local business, but this restaurant is seriously lacking! I was really looking forward to trying this place, but I really should‚Äôve heeded the negative reviews because they represented my experience as well. It was disappointing to say the least. We waited an absurdly long amount of time to get our food and our server didn‚Äôt bother to stop to check on us or refill our drinks. When the food finally got to our table it was cold, the bacon was overcooked and you could tell it had been sitting out for a long time. The server offered to quickly bring a replacement, but at that point we just wanted to eat and get out of that cramped, awkward place. Of course, we weren‚Äôt compensated or anything like that.

We also saw that the people who arrived after us got their food without waiting long at all. The taste of the food wasn‚Äôt terrible, but the quality did not match the price. Their hashbrowns are basically microwaved potato cakes like what you‚Äôd get at McDonald‚Äôs, but not as good. All their sandwiches were almost $20 which is way too high for what you get.

We also witnessed our server berating other members of the staff. The man who brought our food out to us was much more competent and attentive than our server.

Not impressed!

detailedReviews.author: deborah valencia
detailedReviews.text: The porterhouse steak was amazing.  Also had the pork belly appetizer and it was one of the best things I‚Äôve ever eaten.

detailedReviews.author: Linda Wilson
detailedReviews.text: Wonderful food, great service, priced right.

detailedReviews.author: Benjamin Vaterlaus
detailedReviews.text: Good service and amazing food. If you haven't had a leige waffle, you need to try one - awesome!! Such great food and we'll be back as often as we can get to Las Cruces! UPDATE: still amazing. They now have better parking. Food and service is awesome!

detailedReviews.author: Lucy Malkani
detailedReviews.text: It's a cute restaurant  with okay food. The service was awful. It took us an hour and a half to receive our food. When we complained about it, the waitress got huffy and said they were training  new people. My friend said they have a really good breakfast.  We ate dinner there and was not impressed.

detailedReviews.author: Marco Valerio
detailedReviews.text:
Food, service, staff, and the atmosphere were awesome.
Staff were really friendly and professional.

detailedReviews.author: Jeff
detailedReviews.text: Great lunch venue

detailedReviews.author: Jason L Shelby
detailedReviews.text: First time having dinner there. We usually go for brunch. The food was amazing. I had the pot roast with mashed potatoes and Yorkshire pudding.

detailedReviews.author: Sari Barnes
detailedReviews.text: This place is a hit for my husband and I. Service was amazing and food selection is great! I especially love that they are conscious of gluten and other food allergies and are ok with questions about the menu. I would absolutely come here again and look forward to making this a regular spot for brunch or dinner out with family when they come to visit us here.

detailedReviews.author: Bill Schroder
detailedReviews.text: Cool bistro atmosphere.. nist make sure to look for the parking... acceoss the street.. loved it

detailedReviews.author: K L
detailedReviews.text: My cappuccino was amazing!

detailedReviews.author: Kama Michel
detailedReviews.text: Holy Moly!  The menu is great. There is also are vegan AND a GF menus. Delicious. I would ear there everyday.

detailedReviews.author: Net G.
detailedReviews.text: Delicious! Friendly service. The only thing we didn't liked was the Green Chile platter it was too bland. Otherwise everything else was delicious!

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers are genuinely thrilled with their experience. With an average 4.6/5 rating across 100 recent reviews, your restaurant consistently exceeds expectations.

strengthsPerceived: Customers consistently praise the outstanding quality and freshness of the food, with dishes like the Bananas Foster French Toast and sirloin tip sandwich on homemade rye bread receiving specific accolades. - social media marketing can showcase this strength

The ambiance of A Bite of Belgium, characterized by thoughtfully curated decor, soft lighting, and cozy seating, creates a welcoming and comfortable dining experience that customers love. - SEO services can leverage this for better visibility

The attentive and personable service, with staff being knowledgeable and offering helpful suggestions, significantly enhances the dining experience for customers. - review management can highlight this positive aspect
improvementOpportunities: Long wait times and inconsistent service - Boostly marketing services can improve this

We also got Colombian coffee which was the best part. Overall, I wouldn‚Äôt comeback, I‚Äôm just glad to have gone.

neutral.author: Sidney Graham
neutral.text: Nice selection. My waffles were pretty hard and dry, but still tasted fairly good with the toppings added. Very busy, but we made a reservation and were seated quickly.

neutral.author: Sarai Kendrick
neutral.text: Southwest breakfast was excellent. Lamb sandwich was flavorless and not great. Waitress forgot items, didn't refill water.

negative.author: Glen Ernst
negative.text: My potatoes arrived cold and mushy.  My wife‚Äôs food arrived cold and the tampequena stake was tasteless, dry and very tough.

negative.author: Elizabeth G
negative.text:
After hearing this place from other people my sister and I decided to try it out. I ordered the eggs Benedict and my sister ordered the huevos rancheros.
Unfortunately the hollandaise sauce was broken and liquidy and my eggs were raw. My sister was not satisfied with her plate however she still ate it.
I did not eat mine due to the raw egg. It took a while for our server to check on us and I told her my concern and she called the manager. He came over and said they would only refund my eggs (mind you I did not eat anything on that plate including the hashbrowns (which are not made fresh they are frozen) and what they call a side salad). After I told him this (and he could see it) he was looking for an excuse to not refund my plate, but ended up doing so, didn‚Äôt apologize.
I never write reviews however i feel like i needed to because of how we were not checked in throughout the hour we were there and there was only one other table. Also, my plate was 17.50, which is completely overpriced and not worth it. I would think they would make a good sauce, well cooked eggs, and fresh hashbrowns for that price. I would not recommend eating here.

recommendations.title: Generate More Reviews
recommendations.description: Encourage satisfied customers to leave reviews
